title.narrative: Strengthening Community Based Child Protection Responses for New Arrivals in Monguno LGA.

description.narrative:
This 6 months partnership project proposal between Restoration of Hope Initiative (ROHI) and Grow Strong Foundation (GSF) is designed to address the objectives of Child Protection under NHF 2019 Reserve Allocation paper and responds to the need of 260 (150 girls, 110 boys) unaccompanied and separated children and other vulnerable children at risk of abuses through provision of case management response by Identification and documentation, Placement in alternative care, Follow-up of cases, Tracing and Reunification with their primary caregivers and Referral and support to access basic services. As well as reaching 3000 children (1700 girls, 1300 boys) through psycho social support in terms of Structured recreational/creative/social activities for girls and boys particularly for those under 13 years of age link with Life skills education for adolescent girls and boys and Individual and group counseling and mental health support for girls and boys affected by psycho social and mental distress as this will ensure qualitative Child Protection mechanism in place to support new arrivals in Monguno LGA of Borno State North East Nigeria.
The purpose of this project is to strengthen capacity of community based child protection mechanism to detect, prevent and respond to incidence of child rights violation. We shall do this by identifying and systematically engaging community based staff to implement the field based activities. We also intend supporting unaccompanied and Separated Children (UASC) under the case management component and facilitate their reunification and provision of psycho social support, alternative care arrangement including fostering and acquisition of basic skills and knowledge on life skills. Lastly, we will also also provide direct case management to children identified in need of specific child protection support. This will require that we develop and maintain an integrated data base of child protection problems that shall be supported. This data will be shared with the Child Protection Sector Working Group Monthly to get the magnitude, prevalence and the different forms of abuse that new arrivals children suffer
Another component of the project includes advocacy and sensitization for ending violence against new arrivals with the Host Community Stakeholders and persons of concern to ensure equal treatment of new arrivals and Host IDPs by people in authority.
